result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie D Fields

records.addlTxt: State's Discovery Update Cover Letter
State's Discovery Update Cover Letter
State's Discovery Update Cover Letter
State's Discovery Update Cover Letter
State's Discovery Update Cover Letter
State's Initial Discovery Cover Letter

02:30 PM Defendant Willie D Fields in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Willie D Fields in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joy appears via Zoom video. State calls Detective Sergeant Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 2:29 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (2:32 PM). Cross exam by Joy at 2:36 PM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed an Information. Joy has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas. Joy - wants to address bond on both cases. Court will hear argument for bond from parties. Court reviews both files for the bond, $10,000.00 cash on 22CF29 and $1500.00 cash on 22CF24. Joy - bond - asks for total bond of $6,000.00 cash for stated reasons. State - bond - leaves up to Court. Court - bond - 22CF29 - amends bond to $6,000.00 cash and continues bond on 22CF24 - no consumption or possession of alcohol, must submit a sample of breath of blood to law enforcement upon request to determine the amount of alcohol in defendant's system. Court - set for JT.
on Request to Appear Remotely
Request to Appear Remotely - Attorney Joy

Adjustment Number: 22A 000557,
Payable Number: 48571,
Receipt Number: 22R 000914,
Amount: $20.00
Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

03:09 PM Defendant Willie D Fields appears by video from FC jail with attorney Jeffery Joy also appearing by video. Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 22CF24 and 22CF29. Joy has went over complaint in each case and asks for PH, would like within 10 days. Court will have both cases scheduled for PH. Clerk ask for time limits to be extended one day. Court confirms with Joy. Joy willing to waive time limits by one day. Court schedules both cases for PH on 4/11/22 at 2:00 PM. Continues bond in both cases and can address if needed at ARGN. Joy agrees.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Not called on the record, cases 22CF24 and 22CF29. Defendant was previously in the process of retaining Attorney Joy. State indicated Joy was going to try to appear today, but was busy in another court. Court will have rescheduled when Joy is available.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:56 AM Defendant Willie D Fields in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie D Fields appeared by video means. Court reviews file, asks if he contacted SPD. Fields states that he thought Attorney Joy was going to be here today. State has heard from Attorney Joy - working on a notice of retainer/sign paperwork. Court will set at a later time when Attorney Joy is here this afternoon. Court confirms off the record with Attorney Joy that they Joy is working on the paperwork for Fields and Court will set both those matters (22CF24 and 22CF29) to AIA on 3/30/22 at 2:30 PM when Joy is here on other mattres, continues bond on both cases.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:53 AM Defendant Willie D Fields in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie D Fields appeared by video means from FOSO. All parties appear via Zoom. State has filed the complaint today. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Fields understands charges and penalties, has not contacted counel yet. Court reminds him of his options for counsel. Clerk asks State to address bond on 22-1679 as well. State - bond - keep bond on 22-1679 (will be filed hopefully this week yet) at $10,000.00 and amend bond on this matter to $1500.00 cash for stated reasons. Fields states he is only in jail on these matters. Court confirms address. Court - bond - modifies bond on this matter to $1500.00 cash, continues bond on 22-1679, sets this matter for AIA on 3/23/22 at 9:30 AM, set 22-1679 for INIT on 2/16/22 ata 8:30 AM.

Called 9:28 am.  Willie Fields 22-1588 & 22-1679. Fields appears by video from FC jail. Alex Seifert appears by video. CC & CR appear via video. State asks for adjournment for reasons as stated on the record. Court will allow adjournment to 2/15/22 @ 9:45 am. Fields questions bond. Court verifies address. State requests bond to continue. Court continues bond.
